intro: Manglietia hongheensis, commonly known as the Honghe manglietia, is a rare and endemic species native to China. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that bloom in spring. The plant is typically found in moist, shaded forest environments at high elevations. Its leaves are elliptical and glossy, while its bark is thick and rough. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
